CurrentSituation: Today, most decisions are automated using rules, metrics and data-at-rest.
GoalsandObjectives: To receive, process and evaluate new data continuously as it arrives to respond rapidly to problems and opportunities and to use optimization to make automated decisions about next actions.
TechnologyDeployed: Messaging,other real-time data transport, business rules capable of continuous processing, database deployed as a state machine.
UseCaseSummary: Rapid identification and response for well-known and slow-to-change conditions across a variety of processes and industries, including IoT and health monitoring. Used in runtime systems for compliance.

CurrentSituation: Today, most decisions are made using a known models of business conditions.
GoalsandObjectives: Use of AI-based algorithms and real-time data to automatically detect anomalies and opportunities; predict whether further action is needed and to apply optimization to automate or augment decision making.
TechnologyDeployed: AI technologies to convert unstructured to structured data, machine learning, messaging or other technique to push processing,decision-making through pipeline, optimization to decide or make recommendations.
UseCaseSummary: When there is a business benefit in rapidly predicting upcoming problems or immediate opportunities where conditions change continuously and data is highly variable, including IoT use cases, real-time promotions, quality controls, inventory outage predictions.

CurrentSituation: Most BI/analytics systems present users with KPIs or metrics (e.g. exceptions, breached thresholds), but don't provide support for identifying drivers with causal effects on outputs.
GoalsandObjectives: To allow analysts and business user to input desired output variables and automatically identify drivers with causal relationship to the output.
TechnologyDeployed: New generation of BI,analysis software that incorporate machine learning.
UseCaseSummary: To provide decision support capabilities that identify What Happened but also provides information on Why it Happened and what can be done about it.

CurrentSituation: Today, once presented with KPIs via dashboards, users need to use manual data manipulation and experience to identify root causes for KPI deviation from norm.
GoalsandObjectives: To allow analysts' workflow to be guided by system generated recommendations based on historical data, expert identification, and crowd usage patterns.
TechnologyDeployed: Machine learning, n-dimensional analysis, data visualization, advanced,predictive analytics, optimization, rules engines, search conversational AI, NLP, NLG.
UseCaseSummary: To provide decision support capabilities via automation to understand Why something happened without requiring users to spend endless hours on manual exploration of data.

CurrentSituation: Periodic planning that doesn't use latest data and relies on outdated forecasting models. Heavy reliance on stand-alone spreadsheets prone to human errors, and lack governance. Minimal use of predictive analytics.
GoalsandObjectives: To increase confidence in planning and forecasting; enable planning agility in the face of uncertainty; rapidly respond to market changes.
TechnologyDeployed: Budgeting, planning, forecasting, scenario modeling, predictive analytics software.
UseCaseSummary: To provide capabilities for augmenting managers' contextual experience with managing the business with ongoing algorithmic forecasting based on real-time internal and external data.

CurrentSituation: Limited visibly into current state of the enterprise and its external environment. Inability to answer the question: What Happened? Due to untimely, aggregated, and incomplete information.
GoalsandObjectives: To provide instant access to real-time and contextual information about what is going in with the enterprise at any given point in time.
TechnologyDeployed: Streaming data integration,analytics, monitoring,alerting, machine learning, data visualization, data intelligence, data integration tools.
UseCaseSummary: To provide capabilities for instant access or notification of the current state of the enterprise based on real-time internal and external data contextualized by human expertise.

CurrentSituation: Much of the focus of data scientists and/or statisticians in enterprise settings has been on one-off projects and reliance of discrete analytic tools without much governance.
GoalsandObjectives: To provide the enterprise with scalable, extensible, yet governed capabilities to support the full analytics lifecycle on an ongoing basis.
TechnologyDeployed: Data science workbench to prepare data, built,test models, managed,govern them over time in a collaborative environment.
UseCaseSummary: A governed yet flexible environment for data scientists to collaborate among themselves and with their business and IT colleagues that follows full analytic lifecycle.

CurrentSituation: Human computer interaction has been dominated by keyboard/mouse/screen technology. Focus of advanced analytics has been on structure alpha numeric data.
GoalsandObjectives: To incorporate voice, and interaction based on other senses (touch, gestures, etc.) and to use deep learned to derive value from a rich media and text sources.
TechnologyDeployed: Deep learning, transfer learning, NLP, image, voice, video analysis, Q&A systems, speech recognition, conversational AI platforms,corresponding 3rd party services.
UseCaseSummary: To leverage the full range of unstructured and rich media data and combine it with structured data. To utilize a range of human-computer interaction capabilities across a range of in-office and in-field situations.

CurrentSituation: Proliferation of data siloes across a growing number of on-premises and on-the-cloud databases and applications has led to lack of visibility and awareness of all the data assets within an enterprise.
GoalsandObjectives: To enable capture, analysis, and management of all metadata and data profiles, providing professionals with the knowledge required to monetize and protect data assets from becoming liabilities.
TechnologyDeployed: Data cataloguing, lineage, profiling, stewardship tools, meta management, master data definition,control tools.
UseCaseSummary: To discover and analyze where data comes from, how data flows in support of business operations and strategic decisions, and how data is transformed and ultimately consumed.

CurrentSituation: Much of the focus in the past has been on data integration via physical movement of data into a central data warehouse.
GoalsandObjectives: To enable a unified and consistent view of the data across on-premises and on-the-cloud data by utilizing a range of data integration, federation, and virtualization techniques.
TechnologyDeployed: Bulk data movement, composite data frameworks, data access infrastructure, data quality, dynamic data movement.
UseCaseSummary: To have on-demand access to unified data about any entity without the need to always physically move the data into a central data store.

CurrentSituation: Historically, most data processing has been accomplished with RDBMs. Given the variety, velocity, and volume of data today, the tendency to force all data types into a relational model has become untenable.
GoalsandObjectives: To develop a data management architecture and platform consisting of broad capabilities for transactional, behavioral, time series, spatial, and other data types.
TechnologyDeployed: Relational databases, NoSQL or dynamic databases, document orientated databases (XML,JSON), key-accessible databases, graph databases, scalable data connection managers (Hadoop)
UseCaseSummary: A multi-database and/or multi-engine data management environment with optimized processing based on specific workloads.

CurrentSituation: Historically, analytic and transactional data processing has been separate, resulting in challenges for embedding intelligence into operational apps.
GoalsandObjectives: To provide support for mixed workloads including support of real-time insights and recommendations and intelligent enterprise applications.
TechnologyDeployed: RDBMs with analytic-transactional capabilities, in-memory databases, dynamic SQL databases.
UseCaseSummary: Incorporate of insights into the follow of operations to enable in-process decision support and more optimized transaction processing across applications.

CurrentSituation: Content-centric processes are highly manual and lack integration across functional areas and computing resources. These processes are inefficient, error-prone and insecure. Intrinsic value of content is inaccessible.
GoalsandObjectives: To speed up processes, reduce cost, off load low-value tasks, reduce errors, improve compliance and mitigate risk. Enable content and content-centric process analysis.
TechnologyDeployed: Cloud, mobile, content analytics, machine learning, task,process automation, natural language processing, OCR/ICR, eforms, esignatures, automated document generation, content,records management
UseCaseSummary: Intra- and inter-business content workflow automation drives stakeholder satisfaction, improved business metrics and competitive advantage

CurrentSituation: The customer experience is often inconsistent from one channel to the next and/or lacking in relevancy. In addition, layout and content transformations are time-consuming and labor-intensive.
GoalsandObjectives: To accelerate time to value; improve the quality of digital experiences to boost customer engagement and conversions; and improve the productivity of marketers, designers, and other stakeholders responsible for creating/delivering digital experiences.
TechnologyDeployed: AI-enabled template or page layout capabilities, automated tagging /metadata generation, "smart" cropping,other types of asset transformation
UseCaseSummary: Automation the transformation and presentation of content enables organizations to move beyond "craft" to operationalizing digital experience delivery ? optimizing the customer experience whatever the context.

CurrentSituation: Current products and/or services provide little to no guidance on how they can be better used by the current consumer, and do not foster ongoing engagement. Revenue is limited to the product or service being sold, and does not incorporate potential digital and data service enhancements.
GoalsandObjectives: To create product and/or service extensions through DaaS offerings which would be of value, strategically and/or monetarily to current partners.
TechnologyDeployed: Data integration,preparation, data management, data curation, data analysis, application or interface creation
UseCaseSummary: End users are more connected to a product and/or service that provides feedback on how to make better use of the original good/service. Producer can gain feedback about usage, create better user engagement and increase revenue.

CurrentSituation: Most commercial DaaS offerings have been produced by information services industry specialists. Enterprises possess large volumes of data which could be of use to those in related or unrelated industries, yet are not currently able to monetize these assets.
GoalsandObjectives: To create new data products for sale. Enterprises should explore all available channels for externally monetizing data, including data marketplaces, industry clouds, as well as one-on-one second & third-party relationships.
TechnologyDeployed: Data integration,preparation, data management, data curation, data analysis, application or interface creation. Contracts with independent DaaS marketplaces.
UseCaseSummary: Enterprise can recognize new revenue from data assets in license or sales relationships with outside parties. These new relationships are outside of their traditional industry and bring new value to the enterprise.

CurrentSituation: Presenting the right content, at the right time, via the particular channel the customer wants to use for a particular interaction is a tremendous challenge. The explosion in the number of channels that organizations must support -- combined with real-time personalization -- dramatically increases the amount of content organizations need to create/manage/deliver and is driving the need for improved content planning/consumption analytics.
GoalsandObjectives: Improve engagement across channels/increase conversion rates; reduce time to market; optimize content creation spend. Organization need to: implement a "build, buy, borrow" strategy to more effectively source content; leverage AI for content creation/ personalization; and utilize consumption analytics to help reduce spend on content assets that don't provide a return on investment.
TechnologyDeployed: Content marketing platforms (planning/ scheduling), content sourcing solutions (that extend in-house/agency resources with stock assets, social/UGC, content contracted from freelance editorial/ creative networks), Web site solutions,API-first content services, digital asset management systems, product content management solutions. "Content AI", the use of AI/ML to generate, transform, tag, optimize the presentation of content, is an accelerator.
UseCaseSummary: Optimizing the content supply chain ? that is, streamlining the planning, creation, and delivery of content ? is core to an organization's ability to operationalize digital experience delivery and provide consistent, engaging experiences across the many channels through which customers interact with the organization /brand.

CurrentSituation: Digital marketing infrastructures are complex and fragmented making it difficult to orchestrate customer experience from one interaction to another and to optimize investment in customer acquisition based on potential lifetime value of a prospect.
GoalsandObjectives: Make the most compelling offer to every customer/prospect the fastest
TechnologyDeployed: Wide range of systems for managing interactions, content, data, analytics, the business of marketing
UseCaseSummary: Enable every customer interaction to enhance every other interaction in the most economical way possible.

CurrentSituation: The harmonization of online and offline customer experiences is currently ad hoc and disjointed. Offline experiences typically trail digital experiences in a marketing context; but digital experiences are often inferior to offline experiences in customer service context - where digital (and chatbots) support, rather than replace, the in-person agent.
GoalsandObjectives: Enterprises need to emulate high quality digital experiences across all their offline experiences, and vice-versa so that offline and online utilize the best of both types of experiences. This requires consistent performance measures and metrics that enable meaningful comparison of digital and offline experiences. New measures need to be created to supplement NPS, CES, and CSAT across all online and offline encounters.
TechnologyDeployed: IoT, AI, big data, analytics, integrated marketing / sales / service CX systems, customer journey management, mobile, GPS, in-store systems, eCommerce.
UseCaseSummary: Frictionless movement between digital and offline interactions that provide continuity. The experience should be like a train journey that will be managed end-to-end using an integrated, seamless and combined system that includes both the physical elements (train station, train guard, security gates, train) with the digital (online trains enquiry, one-touch ticketing, transactional mobile alerts, mobile promotions, CX feedback).

CurrentSituation: Disaggregated customer engagement strategies results in customers being dropped or poor customer service
GoalsandObjectives: Create "Best" experiences specific to the customer and the enterprise that are consistent and seamless
TechnologyDeployed: Mobile, IoT, Networking, multi-screen multi-application content distribution, interactive processes
UseCaseSummary: Personalized, curated and seamless experiences across the customer journey

CurrentSituation: B2C and B2C sellers have historically focused on standing up digital commerce "stores" for specific digital endpoints, such as a website or mobile application. When new endpoints arise, such as Amazon Echo, Google Home, or IoT, businesses are forced to go back to the drawing board to enable commerce. This approach will only increase in the future, putting a strain on sellers' IT efforts and resulting in differentiated commerce experiences for customers across different channels.
GoalsandObjectives: Support transactions on all current and future customer endpoints. Lower IT costs associated with re-platforming the commerce engine. Reduce friction for customers who wish to make a purchase.
TechnologyDeployed: A decoupled digital commerce engine that can support any customer endpoint by leveraging a RESTful API layer. Responsive webstore design that adapts to wide ranges of endpoints.
UseCaseSummary: Regardless of future endpoints, a customer will be able to engage with the organization's product catalog and make purchases. Interface-free commerce, where customers receive personalized products and services without needing to search.

CurrentSituation: Customer order fulfillment planning and execution is separate from planning and execution of store allocation and replenishment orders. Inventory policies are optimized by channel, stores and online, but sub-optimized for total omni-channel service and cost objectives. Customers are dissatisfied by broken delivery date promises and/or long delivery waits due to lack of real-time enterprise visibility of inventory available-to-promise status and variability in fulfillment execution processes.
GoalsandObjectives: Optimally manage (buy, move, and place) inventory from suppliers to store shelves as common resource to improve in-store service levels and improve customer choice for fulfillment of on-line orders.
TechnologyDeployed: Real-time SKU-level sales,receipts data
UseCaseSummary: Inventory distribution planning and execution optimized holistically to concurrently improve customer order fulfillment and store inventory service levels.

CurrentSituation: For complex products, product implementation is long, complex, and structured process to integrate the product into existing workflows that includes hands on modifications and removal of barriers to interaction with other systems.

TechnologyDeployed: AI, analytics, omni-channel, mobile, cloud, customer service applications, contact center applications
UseCaseSummary: Digital investigation of customer systems, modification of products by an AI engine, and self-deployment reducing the amount of human interaction and time necessary.

CurrentSituation: Customer education for numerous products is a small instruction booklet that comes with the product, some online videos, and a customer service number to call for questions.

UseCaseSummary: ÿCustomer self-education about the product is available real-time anywhere and from any device to support the customer in deriving the highest value from the product specific to their needs.

CurrentSituation: Customer service and support functions have become complex silos of data and channels that results in inconsistent latency plagued experiences for customers.
GoalsandObjectives: Provide a methodology for servicing interactions with appropriate level of agent/self-service to enable more rapid processing of inquiries from simple to complex.
TechnologyDeployed: AI, analytics, omni-channel, predictive models, avatars, customer service applications, contact center applications
UseCaseSummary: Service customers in a timely, contextual, channel independent and predictive manner to deliver differentiated service and support.

CurrentSituation: Customer satisfaction is self-reported through the use of online surveys, but often is plagued by selection bias, survey fatigue, lack of understanding of why the customer acted, and being reactive long after the interaction.
GoalsandObjectives: Provide real-time understanding of customer satisfaction before, during, and after the interaction
TechnologyDeployed: AI, big data, customer analytics, customer intelligence platforms, dynamic data collection, predictive models, dynamic digital assent management,content placement.
UseCaseSummary: Enable real-time customer satisfaction analysis and adjust real-time customer engagement based upon satisfaction analysis to meet the customers' expectations.

CurrentSituation: Trust is unmeasurable. New forms of partnerships and consociation use social media, messaging, company-owned collaboration, advocacy and rewards platforms are trying to drive trust, loyalty and differentiation in the market.
GoalsandObjectives: Provide understanding before, during and after various forms of trust-based marketing technologies and programs are deployed.
TechnologyDeployed: Collaboration platforms (Slack, Microsoft Teams, etc.), Social Media Management Platforms, Web Analytics, Advocacy Management, Employee,Partner Advocacy, AI, IoT, Big Data.
UseCaseSummary: Enable companies to identify which Trust programs and technologies best can be leveraged to drive productivity internally, and trust with customers and partners.

CurrentSituation: Customer rewards are based upon multiple purchases and generally not on the larger impact a customer can have about the perception of a brand.
GoalsandObjectives: ÿProvide customers with additional information and encouragement to continue the relationship
TechnologyDeployed: AI, big data, customer analytics, customer intelligence platforms, dynamic data collection, predictive models, dynamic digital assent management,content placement.
UseCaseSummary: ÿUsing digital technologies, brands can track and measure the impact a customer is having on a brand beyond the transaction and reward that customer appropriately for their impact on the brand.

GoalsandObjectives: By optimizing the enterprise workforce, the final organizational structure, and conscientiously maintaining or creating a new culture, and properly separating or combining HR systems is an opportunity to make great strides in organizational effectiveness, while reducing costs.
TechnologyDeployed: This use case is supported by integrated suites of HR solutions, most often running in the cloud or "as a service", will include analytic tools,advanced forecasting capabilities, may additionally involve services from IT consultants, system integrators, HR specialists,business consultants.
UseCaseSummary: Modern intelligent suites of HR tools, both sides of a transaction can model scenarios and accelerate out of the transaction. New processes can be implemented on a clean-slate without the legacy baggage. Personnel decisions can be more objective and can include broader corporate strategy and tactical considerations.

CurrentSituation: Over time, sequential acquisitions or re-organizations can leave the HR function misaligned, mis-sized and unable to properly support the enterprise.  These conditions result in excessive cost, increased risk and diminished organizational value delivered by the HR organization.
GoalsandObjectives: By optimizing the enterprise HR organization to match the organizational requirements, and optimized HR systems can facilitate greater strategic impact from the HR organization, increasing overall organizational effectiveness and reducing costs.
TechnologyDeployed: This use case is supported by integrated suites of HR solutions, running in the cloud or "as a service", will include analytic tools,advanced forecasting capabilities, involve services from IT consultants, system integrators, HR specialists,business consultants to improve operations while transitioning through the corporate action.
UseCaseSummary: An HR organization that is sized, functionally aligned with organizational requirements and has access to intelligent tools and integrated systems can better attracted, develop, deploy and competitively compensate its workforce, reducing costs, increasing organizational productivity and reducing risk of talent shortages.

CurrentSituation: HR have been historically pressured into increasing operational efficiency at the expense deep domain knowledge and loss of strategic relevance. This cause a downward spiral of value delivered from the HR organization.
GoalsandObjectives: To operate more strategically, HR organizations re-design HR service delivery. The approach is typically a "three legged stool" of HR business partners, HR centers of expertise and shared HR services. This allows for intimacy with the business issues, expertise in complicated areas and service efficiency, in the right proportions.
TechnologyDeployed: This use case is supported by integrated suites of HR solutions, often running in the cloud or "as a service", analytic tools, call center software, advanced forecasting capabilities, services from IT consultants, system integrators, HR specialists,business consultants,even HR process outsourcer.
UseCaseSummary: An HR organization functionally aligned with organizational requirements and structured to provide both efficiency and strategic value can better help the enterprise meet its strategic objectives.

CurrentSituation: All talent and workforce processes are limited to basic throughput measures because of siloed functional tools. Analysis relies on anecdotal information, or manual reconciliation, solutions.
GoalsandObjectives: The adoption and deployment of analytics can better monitor performance at every point in the workforce process, may include applicant fit and engagement, development progress, team effectiveness, impact of rewards, recognition and wellness programs; and operational metrics to support end-to-end analysis of workforce processes.

CurrentSituation: The current purchasing portfolio of a company is managed subjectively using a combination of information extracted from the finance, procurement and ERP systems.  Spend analysis or similar data extraction tools are used to see the data in categories and supplier detail.  Missing details of the items or services being sourced, their risk to source and their financial impact have been calculated manually.

UseCaseSummary: The Kraljic Digital Twin brings together the virtual and physical world  to automate the financial impact and sourcing risk/complexity of each purchased item and service within the purchasing portfolio.  The Kraljic Digital Twin aids in modeling, predicting and optimization of purchased items/services.

CurrentSituation: Organizations utilize a combination of technology applications such as spend analysis, sourcing, and contract management or some combination of similar applications and manual processes to complete the source to supplier enablement activities.
GoalsandObjectives: Fully automated sourcing includes automated and real time supplier identification/selection to compete for sourcing activities, source selection, award, contract and supplier automation.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Next Generation Security
UseCaseSummary: Fully automated sourcing enables real time and complete sourcing plans, recommendations and awards, through to contract completion and supplier enablement.

CurrentSituation: The market analysis process that enables procurement to understand how the supply market works, the direction in which the market is going, the competitiveness and the key suppliers within the market is a manually intensive process.  Manually, market analysis is labor intensive, using descriptive analytics and historical data with little predictability, and leaves cost optimization and partnership opportunities behind.
GoalsandObjectives: Making the market analysis process more intelligent enables the technologies to identify the markets, helps technologies learn to identify the market factors and data insights and brings forward information that can then be modeled in many aspects to help set the right procurement strategy for categories, commodities and items and services.

UseCaseSummary: Intelligent data mining processes sweep internal and external data sources to identify dimensions and factors enabling better market strategies and more informed sourcing related decision making supported by data.  Modeling of current conditions, what if scenario planning and forecasting can help identify the issues that may arise allowing the right supplier to be selected and the right contract to be executed.

CurrentSituation: Procurement sources items from suppliers who are within a category or commodity, identified by their spend analysis tool, sourcing tool or another means.  Capabilities by supplier is a manual process of gathering data from supply base engineers, supplier audits and supplier meetings.  This takes many employees and employee hours to gather, synthesize and utilize the data for further discussions and decisions.
GoalsandObjectives: By automating the data and information to real time for every supplier's capabilities, the sourcing team can make immediate and real time selections for RFIs, Purchases and Contracts.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Next Generation Security, IoT
UseCaseSummary: Organizations can now buy capacity, materials and immediate time within supplier sites to manufacturer required purchase parts because they know the supplier capabilities in real time.

CurrentSituation: Currently suppliers are identified by a supplier number, category, performance or other facets.  Many supply bases are extremely large as no rationalization of the supply base has taken place.  Too many suppliers is too cumbersome for procurement and supply base managers to manage leading to extra management costs, missed leveraging opportunities for better pricing with suppliers and innovation possibilities.
GoalsandObjectives: Too much time is spent trying to right size the supply base but also making sure new suppliers are considered for future business.  This automates the rationalization process as well as identifies in real time the suppliers within given categories and commodities.

UseCaseSummary: Automates the supplier rationalization process from supplier item and service type to commodity to category.  It ties directly into the supplier lifecycle process, helping to manage the supply base.

CurrentSituation: Complex categories from services to transportation to project based sourcing is very manual and data intensive and can take hours to build templates, RFX and contracts.
GoalsandObjectives: Augmented complex sourcing includes automated and real time supplier identification/selection to compete for complex category sourcing activities, source selection,  and augmented award and contracts by employees.

UseCaseSummary: Augmented complex category sourcing enables real time and complete complex category sourcing plans a and recommendations.  Awards and contract completion are augmented with employee involvement to complete the sourcing event.

UseCaseSummary: Continuous real time dashboards of capacity and inventory balances provides the buyer planner a dynamic view of balance, allowing the right purchase or expediting to happen as needed.

CurrentSituation: Currently procurement purchases items as needed from the suppliers identified.  In many cases the suppliers are not monitored for their ethical or sustainable sourcing activities.  In other cases they are monitored by there is too much data to sift through manually to determine supplier compliance.  This can harm a brands reputation purchases from wrong suppliers and also cause issues within the supply chain, value chain and customer.
GoalsandObjectives: By automating the ethical and sustainable sourcing activities organizations improve compliance to Corporate Social Responsibility programs including supplier ethical practices, child labor, conflict minerals and diversity requirements.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Next Generation Security
UseCaseSummary: Integration of compliance aspects  and automating the ethical and sustainable sourcing activities improves visibility and knowledge of a supplier's workplace principles and supplier's compliance.  It allows for real time review of the supply base to the requirements, enabling identification of issues before they arise.

CurrentSituation: Procurement groups build broad based purchase order and contracts with multiple line items identifying fictitious points in time in the future when an item is needed, just to make sure a supplier has the forecast of possible needs.  This leads to extra investment by the supplier, makes the buyer accountable for goods that may or may not be needed and can increase inventory if not monitored at all times.  Monitoring it is typically a manual process.
GoalsandObjectives: Intelligent scheduling of parts and services eliminates fictitious forecasts, scheduling errors and needless expediting.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Next Generation Security
UseCaseSummary: Scheduling of parts, services, and other needs based on requirements within the company is automated intelligently to schedule when needed only, enabling more accurate purchase orders and contracts and improving inventory levels

CurrentSituation: Procurement and other enterprise team members currently conduct quarterly business reviews with preferred and standard suppliers only.  This information is a historical roll up of data from various systems, manual and meeting intensive, and very time consuming.
GoalsandObjectives: Continuous Business Review is a real time review of the supplier's business, performance and projection of expectations based on future business needs.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Next Generation Security
UseCaseSummary:
There is a feedback collection from employees (SCORE) , digital event management,  scorecards and performance  monitored on a continuous basis in real time.  
The real time and continuous basis of these workflows enables procurement and the suppliers to know first hand and at all times their performance levels.

UseCase: Comprehensive Tier N Visibility, Monitor & Remedy

This limited view allows issues with supplier's suppliers and beyond to escape unnoticed or not come up until it is too late causing late deliveries, customer issues and massive resourcing efforts by procurement.
GoalsandObjectives: Tier N visibility is active allowing purchase part supply chain issues to be viewed, monitored and remedied by not only the supply but also the ultimate buyer/customer.

UseCaseSummary: Comprehensive Tier N Visibility, Monitoring and Remedy  enables monitoring and the ability to remedy a supplier issue because of the visibility of all suppliers in the network.

CurrentSituation: Procurement teams must manually aggregate data or use partially developed SRM systems to view the entire supply base and understand their lifecycle within the enterprise. GoalsandObjectives: Completely automating  the current manual and semi automated supply base lifecycle will provide more intelligence on the suppliers and their importance to the business.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Next Generation Security
UseCaseSummary: Automated real time views of the entire supply base from supplier onboarding, to current, previous and upcoming workloads to at risk suppliers to retired or not in current use suppliers will help procurement to manage it's supply base continuously.  Up to date current information that can be modeled for future requirements will help procurement be more proactive in making better and more intelligent decisions.

GoalsandObjectives: A real time or near real time view of financing of the supply base will allow  all types of financed orders to be viewed, monitored, paid and understood automatically and in real time for all suppliers.

CurrentSituation: Regulatory compliance is a manual data aggregation comparison effort.  It is done with data that is historical and also done country by country causing issues across a business.  Non compliance, missed regulations and updates can be missed, putting the organization at risk for large fines.
GoalsandObjectives: Automated real time regulatory data that provides queries and advice on regulations so organizations are compliant at all times.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Next Generation Security
UseCaseSummary: Universal trade automation is real time, automated and able to provide guidance and advice on what needs to be done to be compliant to regulations country to country.  Organizations can now be current, understand where they may be at risk of non compliance and take immediate action to remedy the situation.

CurrentSituation: Procurement tends to lag other functions in innovation activities and crowd sourcing.  Innovation opportunities such as RFX functionality  have been adopted sporadically (more indirect rather than direct), while the opportunities for 'crowd-sourcing' of procurement has been mostly ignored. This has brought forward the fact that procurement is  missing out on alternatives, or even better, sources of supply, particularly during periods of supply constraint or disruption.
GoalsandObjectives: Procurement innovation/crowd sourcing improves both the awareness and the ability to connect to alternative sources of supply and innovation opportunities. This better supports efficiency and innovation goals.

UseCaseSummary: Procurement innovation/crowd-sourcing opens up the procurement options and opportunities for both direct and indirect procurement. CurrentSituation: Procurement, indeed the entire supply chain, should be a key partner in the business innovation process - yet often they are not. While many companies operate a gate-based innovation funnel, it is usually manual or excel based and key participants are often uninformed which leads to delays, excessive launch costs or the inability to 'fast fail'.
GoalsandObjectives: This  improves the efficiency of the overall innovation process by using a more integrated, digital innovation process tool.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, 3D Printing
UseCaseSummary: Digital product innovation means digitalizing the process of moving a 'product' from Ideation to launch with full organizational involvement and key stakeholder input in real-time. The ability to comprehensively manage innovation in real-time means fewer delays, less cost and the ability to iteratively advance more promising ideas while also killing unpromising ones.

CurrentSituation: Change order processes and specification management are highly problematic areas for the business and the role of procurement. These are typical managed inconsistently, often manually, and fail to meet the organizational needs for speed and cost.
GoalsandObjectives: The goal here is to automate the product enhancement process so that the requirements for  procurement are clear and timely.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, 3D Printing
UseCaseSummary: A digital, automated repository of product enhancements and changes - single version of the truth - enables constituents on the business to have a common and timely view. Procurement is thus tied into the typical Change Order process (ECNs) and specification management in a way that enables optimal efficiency both in terms of cost and of speed.

CurrentSituation: Procurement has always been a bottom-line motivated function, yet the tools to do proper cost evaluation and optimization are often lacking. Efforts to apply activity-based costing proved to be too time consuming, so averages and standards remain. This means that individual decisions may not be ideal; or specific selections optimize a part of the product cost at the expense of the whole.
GoalsandObjectives: Automated product cost optimization provides procurement with the objective, timely and relevant tools they need to make informed and 'total system' product cost (direct procurement) decisions.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Blockchain
UseCaseSummary: Automated product cost optimization is an automated tool that monitors cost reductions of ECNs, innovation tradeoffs (Make vs. Buy) as well as all costs that make up COGS - materials, logistics, carrying, and fulfillment.  It also addresses network/regional differences while also enabling true optimization on all inputs and offering a forecast of future spending.

CurrentSituation: Currently, invoice matching (whether receivables or payables) is a mostly manual process with varying degrees of effectiveness. The cost of investigation has also led most companies to write-off amounts less the $500. Visibility has historically been poor.
GoalsandObjectives: Visibility into invoices, invoice discounts, invoice deductions and invoice matching means reconciliation can happen quickly and automatically, freeing humans up to doing more value added tasks.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, RPA, Blockchain
UseCaseSummary: Quite simply an automated tool that matches invoices and takes discounts  and deductions as appropriate. This is a rote task best done by automation and relieves people to do more strategic, value add work while also potentially providing costs savings, improved productivity levels and accuracy (fewer errors).

CurrentSituation: For any function or business process, collecting, capturing and disseminating information is a daunting challenge. In some cases different areas of the business do not communicate well with each other (particularly true in global organizations), in other cases efficiencies may go underappreciated. Either way, the ability to learn from good practices remains inconsistent.
GoalsandObjectives: Intelligent operational efficiencies capture automates the capture of efficiencies both in terms of making sure they are 'counted' as well as making sure that the learnings are disseminated across the breadth of procurement.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Blockchain
UseCaseSummary: Intelligent operational efficiencies capture is the ability to understand both tactical and operational procurement process efficiencies through the use of digital technologies to identify, record and disseminate learnings in real time. Efficient and effectiveness are reasonable outcomes.

CurrentSituation: Rebates are currently calculated based on historical shipments and receipts and the reconciled at the end of each quarter.  Discounts are flagged by systems and manually taken.  Record keeping is tedious, manual and consistently reconciled by multiple enterprise personal adding time and expense.
GoalsandObjectives: Intelligent rebates and discount captures automatically in real time and on a continuous basis, rebates for all purchases linked to a rebate program and discounts offered from suppliers.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Blockchain
UseCaseSummary: P-cards and discounts are intelligently captured in real time, with continuous reconciliation between the buying enterprise and suppliers.   Organizations know the exact rebate and discount amounts and apply to the correct contracts, purchase orders and invoices.

CurrentSituation: Procurement has always been a bottom-line motivated process, yet the tools to do proper cost evaluation and optimization remain lacking. Efforts to apply activity-based costing proved to be too time consuming, so averages and standards remain. This means that individual decisions may not be ideal; or specific selections optimize a part of the non-product cost at the expense of the whole.
GoalsandObjectives: Provide  procurement with the objective, timely and relevant tools they need to make informed and 'total system' non-product cost (indirect procurement) decisions.
TechnologyDeployed: Cloud, advanced analytics,blockchain are all enablers here.

Would also address network/regional differences. The tool would enable true optimization on all inputs and offer a forecast of future spending.

UseCase: Automated Enabled Source to Contract to Signature
CurrentSituation: The mechanics of the procurement contracting process are cumbersome and manually intensive; often resulting in delays or even lost/non-executed paperwork. This can mean delays, cost increases, or loss of available supply.
GoalsandObjectives: Automating the contracting process means far less likelihood of administrative delays or 'dropping the ball' and a more predictable and reliable process.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Blockchain
UseCaseSummary: Automation of the full contract authoring to negotiation to signature process means a more consistent and reliable process of executing contracts. This would also include  certificate of insurance/compliance. It would automate the collection of information, in real time, and even enable auto-contracting in authorized instances. Cost and speed are enhanced.

UseCase: Automated Enabled Call-offs to SLA and Contract
CurrentSituation: As enterprises have become global (both in terms of customers and suppliers) the necessity of driving efficiency through global contracts has become de rigeur. The requirements of these contracts, however, can become burdensome in the sense that contracted quantities may not be fully met - either because the volumes targets were off or because non-sanctioned, alternative supply was used. Either way, penalty fees may ensue.
GoalsandObjectives: Automated call offs and SLA processes identify authorized suppliers and prevents 'rogue' procurement. As supply is required, automated call-offs ensure that service-level-agreements are adhered to and contracts fulfilled.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive, Blockchain
UseCaseSummary: A digitally-enabled contract manager enables automated call offs to the required supply contract obligations ensuring that the proper suppliers are used and that service-level agreements are met. This impacts Inventory, orders, contract renewals and even sunset clauses, and optimizes cost and avoids unnecessary penalty fees.

CurrentSituation: Most procurement inventory, planning and routing processes are disconnected and not integrated into a broad pan-supply chain view that includes service levels and optimal sourcing points. This creates inefficiency, often with negative implications for factory performance and eventual OTIF.
GoalsandObjectives: Intelligent inventory planning and routing aims to fully integrate the procurement functions into the planning and execution elements of the supply chain so that 'smart' decisions can be made in real time for sourcing locations and options.

CurrentSituation: Traditional Vendor-Managed Inventory (VMI) processes have been manually intensive, with VMI 'planners' tasked with identifying current inventory levels at customer sites, overlaid with the best available demand plans to develop an appropriate fulfillment schedule. The manual nature of this process makes it quite cumbersome and often imprecise - leading many to abandon the effort.
GoalsandObjectives: Digital Ecosystem VMI is envisioned as a next-generation form of VMI where modern visibility and AI driven decision-making replaces the old, manual process. VMI  removes unnecessary limitations and flaws, driving up value and drives down administrative cost.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive
UseCaseSummary: This use case means dynamic visibility into inventory consumption and capacity utilization at customer/replenishment sites with automated reordering and fulfillment based on the most recent iteration of consumer demand. This means a more efficient VMI process, with more accurate and timely replenishment shipments to ensure higher levels of in-stock and optimal levels of inventory.

CurrentSituation: Procurement is largely still a manual effort. Digital data sources are used but many decisions made by procurement professionals are based on experience, instinct, and gut feel when calculating the balance between supply and demand. While this has generally worked for many companies, it is far from ideal, certainly not optimized and rarely done in real time.
GoalsandObjectives: A digital procurement assistant augments the human procurement professional by automating rote tasks and ensuring that they are done quickly and in a timely fashion. Relieving the procurement professional from these repetitive tasks allows them to focus on much more strategic, value-added tasks.
TechnologyDeployed: Enterprise Hardware, Personal devices, Cloud, Big data/analytics, Mobile, Applications, Connectivity Services, Cognitive
UseCaseSummary: The digital procurement assistant enables automated ordering from suppliers, auctions, or supply base/catalogues; makes informed tradeoff decisions between various sources of supply (such as a supplier with inventory vs. others for exception management based on % of ability to fulfill ) all in real-time and as a complement to the employee.
